perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that the Master Franchisee must maintain insurance, while the modified version suggests that they may maintain insurance. The liability coverage amounts are also reduced to lower amounts from the original to the modified versions, creating an ambiguity as to the required level of insurance coverage. A contradiction is introduced as insurance for the operation is not required.

perturbation.original_text:
4.1 Continuing Fees Payable to Us 
You shall pay the following continuing fees to us each month during the term of this Agreement:

4.2.1 You shall pay to us a royalty fee based on revenue generated by Unit Franchisees (the "Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee") equal to twenty-five percent (25%) of aggregate royalty fees paid to you by Unit Franchisees in the Master Territory pursuant to their Unit Franchise Agreements. The Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee shall be paid by you to us in the manner provided in Section 4.3 of this Agreement by the fifteenth(15 th ) day of each calendar month based on royalty fees generated and received during the previous calendar month.
perturbation.changed_text:
4.1 Continuing Fees Payable to Us
You may pay the following continuing fees to us each month during the term of this Agreement:

4.2.1 You shall pay to us a royalty fee based on revenue generated by Unit Franchisees (the "Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee") equal to ten percent (10%) of aggregate royalty fees paid to you by Unit Franchisees in the Master Territory pursuant to their Unit Franchise Agreements. The Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee shall be paid by you to us in the manner provided in Section 4.3 of this Agreement by the fifteenth(15 th ) day of each calendar month based on royalty fees generated and received during the previous calendar month.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that the Master Franchisee must pay fees, while the modified version suggests that they may pay fees. The royalty fee percentage is also reduced to a lower amount from the original to the modified version, creating an ambiguity as to whether payment is obligatory and as to the obligatory percentage.

perturbation.original_text:
5.14 Solicitation Advertising
You shall conduct advertising to solicit Applicants for the purchase of Unit Franchisees in the Master Territory ("Solicitation Advertising"). You shall expend not less than $5,000 each month on such Solicitation Advertising.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.14 Solicitation Advertising
You may conduct advertising to solicit Applicants for the purchase of Unit Franchisees in the Master Territory ("Solicitation Advertising"). You may expend no more than $1,000 each month on such Solicitation Advertising.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that the Master Franchisee must conduct advertising and expend no less than $5,000, while the modified version suggests that they may conduct advertising and expend no more than $1,000. This creates an ambiguity as to whether payment is obligatory and the required amount to spend if it is.
